title: Understanding the Importance of Zero
text: Visualizations that compare quantities should start at zero to avoid misleading interpretations.

title: Identifying the Visualization Type
text: Visualizations that use rectangular bars to represent data are often used to compare different categories.

title: Recognizing the Axis
text: The y-axis in certain visualizations should always start at zero to accurately reflect the data's scale.

title: Avoiding Misleading Visuals
text: Visualizations that do not start at zero can exaggerate differences between data points.

title: Common Usage
text: These visualizations are commonly used in reports and presentations to show comparisons.
